oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Housewives’ League plans for annual luncheon, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about an event of the Housewives’ League. The caption tells of “the annual January luncheon to be sponsored by the Housewives’ League on Friday, January 12, at the Hermitage Hotel. Judge Camille Kelley of the Memphis Juvenile Court, will be the speaker. Committee members seen planning for the luncheon at a recent meeting at the home of Mrs. J. J. Humphreys, co-chairman, on Franklin Road, are, left to right: Mrs. M. P. Brothers, Mrs. W. A. Bass, Mrs. Humphreys and Mrs. Carl Matthews, co-chairmen; Mrs. E. H. Murrell, Mrs. Darcy Bone, Mrs. W. W. Gilliam, and, back row, Mrs. William F. Burton, Mrs. W. M. Lassiter, and Mrs. Robert L. Lawrence, Jr.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
